thread.title: New Zealand men's sprint team overcome Germany in gold medal ride
thread.title_full: New Zealand men's sprint team overcome Germany in gold medal ride

title: New Zealand men's sprint team overcome Germany in gold medal ride
text:
New Zealand men's sprint team overcome Germany in gold medal ride Last updated 19:58, February 27 2017 MATTHEW CHILDS/REUTERS 
Sam Webster, left, Ethan Mitchell, and Eddie Dawkins led throughout the final. 
The New Zealand men's sprint team have shone brightly on Oscars night in Los Angeles. 
Across town at the Velo Sports Center in Carson, Ethan Mitchell, Sam Webster and Eddie Dawkins delivered a composed ride to overpower Germany in the gold medal race at the fourth round of the UCI World Cup on Monday [NZ time]. 
World champions New Zealand led throughout the final to power home in 43.710 secs and topple Germany, who were victorious in the last round in Cali, Colombia, earlier this month. Graham Watson 
The New Zealand men's sprint team of Ethan Mitchell, Sam Webster and Eddie Dawkins took out gold in Los Angeles. 
The New Zealand trio clocked 43.620 secs to be fastest in the second round and qualify for the final against Germany, who were only 0.3s slower in winning their clash. 
Poland captured the bronze after overcoming France in the battle for third and fourth. 
The Kiwi men's sprint sparked a nine-medal haul by the New Zealand team in LA, the most they have achieved in a single World Cup. They were awarded World Cup round winners for what is believed to be the first time. 
New Zealand team won a further four medals. Silver medals went to Racquel Sheath and Michaela Drummond in the women's madison and Campbell Stewart and Tom Sexton in the men's madison. 
Jaime Nielsen took out bronze in the women's individual pursuit.
